greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 16, after which, if (2*a(n-1)) - 1 = product_{k >= 1} (p_k)^(c_k) then a(n) = product_{k >= 1} (p_{k-1})^(c_k), where p_k indicates the k-th prime, A000040(k).
comment: Iterates of A064216 starting from value 16.
See also the comments in A246344.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1001
example: Start with a(0) = 16; then after each new term is obtained by doubling the previous term, from which one is subtracted, after which each prime factor is replaced with the previous prime:
mathematica: nxt[n_]:=Times@@(NextPrime[#,-1]&/@(Flatten[Table[#[[1]],{#[[2]]}]&/@ FactorInteger[2 n-1]])); NestList[nxt,16,50] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 04 2015 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
xref: A246344 gives the terms of the same cycle when going to the opposite direction from 16.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 24 2014
